alert.note: Alert for Central Columbia River Gorge; Upper Hood River Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 03 at 2:33PM PST until January 05 at 12:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PST TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow, with areas of sleet and freezing rain. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches in the Columbia River Gorge, with 8 to 12 inches of new snow for the Upper Hood River Valley. Bulk of this precipitation will occur Tuesday afternoon into Tuesday evening. Light ice accumulations of up to a tenth of an inch are possible. * WHERE...In Washington, Central Columbia River Gorge. In Oregon, Upper Hood River Valley and Central Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...Until midnight PST Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult at times.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Drivers should be prepared for icy or snow covered roads and very dangerous winter like driving conditions. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map

area.areaDesc: Central Columbia River Gorge; Upper Hood River Valley
